channel.title: 1 connection per ip AND real rs teleporting

item.title: 1 connection per ip AND real rs teleporting
item.dc:creator: @cows1471 cows1471
item.description:
@cows1471 wrote:

[quote="`Rich, post:2, topic:289102"] public boolean checkConnections(String s) { int i = 0; for (Player p : Engine.players) { if (p.playerConnection.equals(s)) { i++; } } if (i == 3) return true; return false; }

That’s how I do it (I allow 3 connections from a single IP), it’s going to be different for you, though. Although, there’s an example of how to do it.[/quote]

would u have to add anything else except a boolean?

Read full topic
item.source: 1 connection per ip AND real rs teleporting

item.title: 1 connection per ip AND real rs teleporting
item.dc:creator: @_ikram _ikram
item.description:
@_ikram wrote:

[quote="`Rich, post:2, topic:289102"] public boolean checkConnections(String s) { int i = 0; for (Player p : Engine.players) { if (p.playerConnection == s) { i++; } } if (i == 3) return true; return false; }

That’s how I do it (I allow 3 connections from a single IP), it’s going to be different for you, though. Although, there’s an example of how to do it.[/quote]

Right? but why not make all life’s easier.

Open your server class, search for:

} if (num > 1) { banHost(host, num); return false; }

The number 1 is the limit to connections per ip.

Read full topic
item.source: 1 connection per ip AND real rs teleporting

item.title: 1 connection per ip AND real rs teleporting
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

public boolean checkConnections(String s) { int i = 0; for (Player p : Engine.players) { if (p.playerConnection.equals(s)) { i++; } } if (i == 3) return true; return false; }

That’s how I do it (I allow 3 connections from a single IP), it’s going to be different for you, though. Although, there’s an example of how to do it.

Read full topic
